issue.title: add al_get_window_borders() and implement for X11
issue.body:
Fixes https://github.com/liballeg/allegro5/issues/1496

I added a function to query window borders (like SDL_GetWindowBordersSize) and made al_set_window_position and al_get_window_position both use *outer* window coordinates for X11.

Also added a swap button and move-to-same-place key to ex_windows to test the changes.

I initially thought just using outer coordinates is fine as https://liballeg.org/a5docs/trunk/display.html#al_set_window_position and https://liballeg.org/a5docs/trunk/display.html#al_get_window_position do not specify if they mean inner or outer coordinates. However https://liballeg.org/a5docs/trunk/display.html#al_set_new_window_position specifically mentions the "top left pixel of the client area". So considering that, I'd be fine with changing the PR to use inner coordinates everywhere, should be easy to change now. Also for what it's worth, SDL uses inner coordinates for everything (but provides SDL_GetWindowBordersSize to easily convert between inner and outer).

comment.body:
> Hmm... borders aren't being got under my KDE. Investigating.

Let me install KDE here as well. Maybe that's what the old XTranslateCoordinates was for and we need both depending on WM *sigh* I'll also try the SDL build and if that works can at least just copy more code :)

issue.title: Use 16-bit operand for fnstsw instruction
issue.body: EDIT: Whoops, this was a mistake, closing it in error :)

comment.body:
%ax (what you have now) is correct, %eax is wrong.

This was fixed back in 2009 in commit ed688d82020ee5c8c31dd8ac921c5be1a38a427c and I mistakenly sent a PR to un-do that, sorry :)

issue.title: Use 16-bit operand for fnstsw instruction
issue.body: EDIT: Whoops, this was a mistake, closing it in error :)

comment.body:
*Is* this a mistake? - seems you're correct about AX vs EAX
https://godbolt.org/z/7x8WxdEjP

issue.title: Use 16-bit operand for fnstsw instruction
issue.body:
See [Debian bug 518732](https://alioth-lists-archive.debian.net/pipermail/pkg-allegro-maintainers/2009-May/000251.html):
> FNSTSW is "Store FPU Status Word". This status word is a 16-bit value so the destination register should be %ax, not %eax. Apparently old versions of binutils were a bit lax.

Fixes compilation error message: ./src/i386/icpus.s:70: Error: suffix or operands invalid for `fnstsw'

comment.body: Hmm, actually, maybe don't merge this one without a bit of testing.  Playing around with this on godbolt.org I can get errors with `%eax` but with `%ax` it works fine.  Strange...

pull_request.title: Use 16-bit operand for fnstsw instruction
pull_request.body:
See [Debian bug 518732](https://alioth-lists-archive.debian.net/pipermail/pkg-allegro-maintainers/2009-May/000251.html):
> FNSTSW is "Store FPU Status Word". This status word is a 16-bit value so the destination register should be %ax, not %eax. Apparently old versions of binutils were a bit lax.

Fixes compilation error message: ./src/i386/icpus.s:70: Error: suffix or operands invalid for `fnstsw'

issue.title: You've removed Allegro 5's founders from the GitHub project

comment.body:
Well, yes that is true. And I am hardly one to speak since I also abandoned
Allegro. But it still irks me to see people come in here and complain about
a situation they caused themselves. I appreciate those who keep
contributing more.

On Thu, 26 Oct 2023, 09:07 elias-pschernig, ***@***.***>
wrote:

> Don't feed the trolls (or the troll king?) Nothing is or has been
> abandoned and old people leaving and new people joining (and some going
> crazy and forking etc.) is normal for an open source project. And what is
> this SDL you speak of?
>
> —
> Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub
> <https://github.com/liballeg/allegro5/issues/1490#issuecomment-1780221244>,
> or unsubscribe
> <https://github.com/notifications/unsubscribe-auth/AAARM6ITWNLQ2EAL3MJR3UDYBGSVVAVCNFSM6AAAAAA6BMUFOOVHI2DSMVQWIX3LMV43OSLTON2WKQ3PNVWWK3TUHMYTOOBQGIZDCMRUGQ>
> .
> You are receiving this because you commented.Message ID:
> ***@***.***>
>

issue.title: You've removed Allegro 5's founders from the GitHub project

comment.body: Don't feed the trolls (or the troll king?) Nothing is or has been abandoned and old people leaving and new people joining (and some going crazy and forking etc.) is normal for an open source project. And what is this SDL you speak of?

issue.title: You've removed Allegro 5's founders from the GitHub project

comment.body:
If you are honest you have to admit that you and the other founders
abandoned Allegro years ago, at which point Allegro largely became
outdated. Siegelord is one of the few who kept it going.

If you want to come back now, you can fork off your own version. But it is
probably better if we put our effort in helping SDL in stead.

On Thu, 26 Oct 2023, 07:10 Trent Gamblin, ***@***.***> wrote:

> The Allegro community deserves better than this! I think it's time you
> issue an apology to the community...
>
> —
> Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub

Fixes https://github.com/liballeg/allegro5/issues/1496

comment.body:
Ok, for windows I'll have to revert https://github.com/liballeg/allegro5/commit/fead757535d9d416cd956880c5574ad215582d0a and then add that logic to al_get/set functions.

So yeah, let's do inner coordinates for this PR as well.

commits.message: Android: delete local JNI string references. Use the jstring type in _jni_getString().

pull_request.title: Android: delete local JNI string references and use the jstring type
pull_request.body: This patch calls `DeleteLocalRef` to delete local JNI string references and uses the `jstring` type in `_jni_getString()`.
